verses.verse: The elders have ceased gathering at the gate, And the young men from their (Is. 24:8; Jer. 7:34) music.
The joy of our heart has ceased; Our dance has turned into (Jer. 25:10; Amos 8:10) mourning.
(Job 19:9; Ps. 89:39; Jer. 13:18) The crown has fallen from our head. Woe to us, for we have sinned!
Because of this our heart is faint; (Ps. 6:7) Because of these things our eyes grow dim;
Because of Mount Zion which is (Is. 27:10) desolate, With foxes walking about on it.
You, O LORD, (Ps. 9:7; Hab. 1:12) remain forever; (Ps. 45:6) Your throne from generation to generation.
(Ps. 13:1; 44:24) Why do You forget us forever, And forsake us for so long a time?
(Ps. 80:3, 7, 19; Jer. 31:18) Turn us back to You, O LORD, and we will be restored; Renew our days as of old,
Unless You have utterly rejected us, And are very angry with us!

Ezekiel’s Vision of God Now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by (Ezek. 3:15, 23; 10:15) the River Chebar, that (Matt. 3:16; Mark 1:10; Luke 3:21; Acts 7:56; 10:11; Rev. 4:1; 19:11) the heavens were opened and I saw (Ex. 24:10; Num. 12:6; Is. 1:1; 6:1; Ezek. 8:3; Dan. 8:1, 2) visions of God.
On the fifth day of the month, which was in the fifth year of King Jehoiachin’s captivity,

the word of the LORD came expressly to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the River Chebar; and (1 Kin. 18:46; 2 Kin. 3:15; Ezek. 3:14, 22) the hand of the LORD was upon him there.

Then I looked, and behold, (Is. 21:1; Jer. 23:19; 25:32; Ezek. 13:11, 13) a whirlwind was coming (Jer. 1:14) out of the north, a great cloud with raging fire engulfing itself; and brightness was all around it and radiating out of its midst like the color of amber, out of the midst of the fire.
(Ezek. 10:15, 17, 20; Rev. 4:6-8) Also from within it came the likeness of four living creatures. And (Ezek. 10:8) this was their appearance: they had (Ezek. 10:14) the likeness of a man.
Each one had four faces, and each one had four wings.
Their legs were straight, and the soles of their feet were like the soles of calves’ feet. They sparkled (Dan. 10:6; Rev. 1:15) like the color of burnished bronze.
(Ezek. 10:8, 21) The hands of a man were under their wings on their four sides; and each of the four had faces and wings.
Their wings touched one another. The creatures did not turn when they went, but each one went straight (Ezek. 1:12; 10:20-22) forward.

As for (Ezek. 10:14; Rev. 4:7) the likeness of their faces, each (Num. 2:10) had the face of a man; each of the four had (Num. 2:3) the face of a lion on the right side, (Num. 2:18) each of the four had the face of an ox on the left side, (Num. 2:25) and each of the four had the face of an eagle.
Thus were their faces. Their wings stretched upward; two wings of each one touched one another, and (Is. 6:2; Ezek. 1:23) two covered their bodies.
And (Ezek. 10:11, 22) each one went straight forward; they went wherever the spirit wanted to go, and they did not turn when they went.

As for the likeness of the living creatures, their appearance was like burning coals of fire, (Ps. 104:4; Rev. 4:5) like the appearance of torches going back and forth among the living creatures. The fire was bright, and out of the fire went lightning.
And the living creatures ran back and forth, (Zech. 4:10; (Matt. 24:27; Luke 17:24)) in appearance like a flash of lightning.
Now as I looked at the living creatures, behold, (Ezek. 10:9) a wheel was on the earth beside each living creature with its four faces.

(Ezek. 10:9, 10) The appearance of the wheels and their workings was (Dan. 10:6) like the color of beryl, and all four had the same likeness. The appearance of their workings was, as it were, a wheel in the middle of a wheel.
When they moved, they went toward any one of four directions; they did not turn aside when they went.
As for their rims, they were so high they were awesome; and their rims were (Ezek. 10:12; (Zech. 4:10); Rev. 4:6, 8) full of eyes, all around the four of them.
(Ezek. 10:16, 17) When the living creatures went, the wheels went beside them; and when the living creatures were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up.
